intro: Marila alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaved marila, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its alternate arrangement of leaves, which are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and stamens that are prominently displayed. Marila alternifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
